revision.text:
{{talkheader}} {{WikiProject Firearms|class=C | b1 = no | b2 = yes | b3 = yes | b4 = yes | b5 = yes|importance=mid}} {{WikiProject Military History|class=C | b1 = no | b2 = yes | b3 = yes | b4 = yes | b5 = yes|Weaponry=yes|WWI=yes}} == Detail in Photo == detail closeup in the image displays a faded arabic marking. how do you translate it?[[Special:Contributions/188.25.55.134|188.25.55.134]] ([[User talk:188.25.55.134|talk]]) 18:50, 18 September 2011 (UTC) : It translates to (police) with the same pronunciation, and the numbers are 7531 — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Taiko 911|Taiko 911]] ([[User talk:Taiko 911|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Taiko 911|contribs]]) 12:01, 27 September 2012 (UTC) == name ambiguous == model 1903 relates to the [[Colt_M1900#Mauser_C96|colt m1900]]. it would be nice if you could mention it. Paul[[Special:Contributions/188.25.55.134|188.25.55.134]] ([[User talk:188.25.55.134|talk]]) 18:53, 18 September 2011 (UTC) == more detail == world.guns.ru (link mentioned in article) has much interesting info which would be nice in the article: * "This pistol can be called as a forerunner of most semi-automatic pistols in the world, in one or another respect." * "Significantly underpowered by modern standards" * "Barrel is locked to the frame by several radial ribs." It's a bit hidden in the mentioning of "blowback", but I think should be explicitly stated somewhere in the article that the barrel is fixed to the frame during operation, and that the breech is not locking in any way like they do in all modern handguns. Of course this is connected to the cartridge being considered as weak by modern standards.
--[[User:BjKa|BjKa]] ([[User talk:BjKa|talk]]) 08:40, 1 August 2014 (UTC)
